text:
Hello, is anyone able to help me with my blog filter? I need a user to be able to select at least two filters at once. <https://go.accelitymarketing.com/resources>  `{% for item in my_topics %}`
`<a href="{{ group.absolute_url }}/topic/{{item.slug}}">`
`<div class="filter-single">`
    `<span>{{ item }}</span>`
`</div>`
`</a>`
  
`{% endfor %}`
Is there a playbook for speeding up CMS Blogs... like looking into how js and images are loading, using async and lazy loading... resizing images dynamicly and whatsorts
Hey Martin, this article may help you out: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/tutorials/speed>
<@U2H3TT8F2> thanks... diving into it right now ...
Let us know if you have any further questions or feedback on that doc. We plan to continously improve it over time

<@U26BLKGE4> <@UQERM7BLY> <@U504BHZ6K> - Thanks for raising your hands :slightly_smiling_face: We're hunting for CMS Hub hosted websites that have 90+ google page speed scores.

If you happen to have any that you/your clients want to show off - please DM me. :slightly_smiling_face:

Separately, we're always lookin for community developers who might want to write up best practices/tips for speed optimization on CMS Hub.

Plz LMK if that's interesting at all.
Does anyone have experience using buttons to change an image or video inline on a HubSpot landing page (i.e. using the CSS property `pointer-events` or some other method?).
